utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok. Here's his diaper bag, and his uh, Mr. Winky, and uh...oh, him. Hi!

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: So how did everything go?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, great. Great. There was a projectile, uh, throwing up incident, but he started it.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Well, we've gotta go.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Oh, right. Um, I've got some news. It's about us.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, you and me?

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Uh, no, Susan and me.

utterance.speaker: SUSAN
utterance.content: The other us.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: We're uh, we're getting married.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: As in, "I now pronounce you wife and wife" married?

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Anyway, we'd like you to come, but we totally understand if you don't want to.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Why wouldn't I want to come? I had fun at the first wedding.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Look I just thought that...

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No no no, I mean, hey, why shouldn't I be happy for you? What would it say about me if I couldn't revel in your joy? I'm revelling baby, believe me!

utterance.speaker: SUSAN
utterance.content: Is your finger caught in that chair?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Mmm hmmm.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Want us to go?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: This is so cool. You're actually gonna be on television.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: It really hit me last night. I'm gonna be on Days of our Lives. And then I started thinkin' about all of u, and how these are the days of our lives..

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yes! Carol and Susan's caterer had a mountain bike accident this weekend, and she's in a full body cast.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: They want me to do it, which is really cool, seeing as I've never catered before, and I really need the money, and this isn't a problem for you, is it?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Would it matter?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, you are so great! Thank you!

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Are you really not going?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I am really not going. I don't get it. They already live together, why do they need to get married?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: They love each other, and they wanna celebrate that love with the people that are close with them.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: If you wanna call that a reason.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Who's the bitterest man in the living room, the bitterest man in the living room? Hi, neighbor.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ross, I thought you were over this.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Look, that has nothing to do with this, ok? She's my ex-wife. If she were marrying a guy, none of you'd expect me to be there.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, if she were marrying a guy, she'd be like the worst lesbian ever.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Did I miss it? Did I miss it?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No, I'm on right after this guy shoots himself.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Whoa, she's pretty.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, and she's really nice too. She taught me all about how to work the cameras, and smell-the-fart acting.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I'm sorry, what?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: It's like, you got so many lines to learn so fast, that sometimes you need a minute to remember your next one. So while you're thinkin' of it, you take this big pause where you look all intense, you know, like this.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, ok.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: There's my scene, there's my scene. "Mrs. Wallace, I'm Dr. Drake Ramoray, your sister's neurosurgeon.

utterance.speaker: MRS. WALLACE
utterance.content: Is she gonna be all right?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I'm afraid the situation is much worse than we expected. Your sister is suffering from a..subcranial hematoma. Perhaps we can discuss this over coffee.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Nice!

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: That's great!

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Excellent!

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: For a minute there I thought you were actually tryin' to smell something.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: That is so good! Do it again!

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: All right, all right. "Damnit Braverman, it's right there on the chart!"

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: That's great. All right, I gotta get to work, I got a big dinosaur bone to inspect.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No no, that's me.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, hello.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, thanks. I couldn't uh...

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Is everything ok?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Um, no, huh-uh. One of my clients died on the massage table today.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh my god.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: That's a little more relaxed than you want them to get.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, um, she was 82 years old. Her name was um, Mrs. Adelman.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, honey.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, it's just so strange. I mean, she probably woke up today and thought, "ok, I'll have some breakfast, and then I'll take a little walk, and then I'll have my massage." Little did she know God was thinking, "Ok, but that's it." Oh, but the weirdest thing was, ok, I was cleansing her aura when she died, and when the spirit left her body, I don't think it went very far.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I think it went into me.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: God, this is so hard. I can't decide between lamb or duck.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, of course, lambs are scarier. Otherwise the movie would've been called Silence of the Ducks.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, who ordered what?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, I believe I had the half-drunk cappuccino with the lipstick on the rim.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yes, and this with the cigarette butt in it, is that decaf?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh god.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I can't believe you're so uptight about your mom comin'.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I know, but it's just it's the first time, and I just don't want her to think that because I didn't marry Barry, that my life is total crap, you know?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Talk about crap. Try listening to Stella Niedman tell the story of her and Rod Steiger for the hundredth time.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Uh, Pheebs, how long do you think this lady'll be with us?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I don't know. I mean, she obviously has some kind of unfinished business. Sit up!

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREEN
utterance.content: There she is.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Mom!

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: Sweetie! So this is where you work? Oh, it's wonderful! Is it a living room? Is it a restaurant? Who can tell? But I guess that's the fun.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Pretty much.

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: Monica! You look gorgeous! Last time I saw you, it was eat or be eaten.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: This is Joey, and Phoebe, and this is Chandler, and you remember Ross.

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: Oh hello, Ross.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hi, Mrs. Green.

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: So, what do you think of my daughter in the apron with the big job?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh Mom!

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: If you didn't pour the coffee, no one would have anything to drink.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Believe me, sometimes that happens.

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: This is just so exciting. You know, I never worked. I went straight from my father's house to the sorority house to my husband's house. I am just so proud of you.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I know who it is you remind me of. Evelyn Dermer. 'Course, that's before she got the lousy face lift. Now she looks like Soupy Sales.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Pheebs, who's Evelyn Dermer?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I don't know. Who's Soupy Sales?

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: Oh my god, there's an unattractive nude man playing the cello.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yeah, well just be glad he's not playing a smaller instrument.

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: You have some life here, sweetie.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I know. And Mom, I realize you and Daddy were upset when I didn't marry Barry and get the big house in the suburbs with all the security and everything, but this is just so much better for me, you know?

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: I do. You didn't love Barry. And I've never seen you this happy. I look at you and I think, oh, this is what I want.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: For...me.

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: Well, not just for you.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well, what do you mean?

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: I'm uh, considering leaving your father.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: All right. Tell me if this is too cute. Lesbian wedding, chicken breasts.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh god. I think I'm gonna be sick.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Why? It's not like I'm putting little nipples on them.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: And you had no idea they weren't getting along?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: None.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: They didn't fight a lot?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No! They didn't even talk to each other. God, how was I supposed to know they were having problems?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: In my day, divorce was not an option.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, look who's up.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I just can't believe this is happening. I mean, when I was little, everybody's parents were getting divorced. I just figured as a grownup I wouldn't have to worry about this.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Is there any chance that you can look at this as flattering? I mean, she's doing it because she wants to be more like you.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well, then, you know, couldn't she have just copied my haircut?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You know, it's funny when my parents got divorced, they sent me to this shrink, and she told me that all kids have a tendency to blame themselves. But in your case it's actually kinda true.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: That's him.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Damn. My mail order grandfather hasn't come yet.

utterance.speaker: MR A
utterance.content: Phoebe?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yes, hi, Mr. Adelman. Thanks for meeting me.

utterance.speaker: MR A
utterance.content: Oh, that's all right, although you did cut into my busy day of sitting.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Um, do you wanna sit?

utterance.speaker: MR A
utterance.content: Oh, no, please, I spent most of mid-morning trying to stand up. Now uh, what can I do for you, my dear?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I don't know how to say this, but I think when your wife's spirit left her body, it um, kind of stuck around in me.

utterance.speaker: MR A
utterance.content: You're saying, my wife is in you?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah. Ok, you don't have to believe me but um, can you think of any unfinished business she might have had, like any reason she'd be hanging around?

utterance.speaker: MR A
utterance.content: Well, I don't know what to tell you dear. The only thing I can think of is that she always used to say that before she died, she wanted to see everything.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Everything?

utterance.speaker: MR A
utterance.content: Everything.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Whoa, that's a lot of stuff.

utterance.speaker: MR A
utterance.content: Oh, wait, I remember, she also said she wanted to sleep with me one last time.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I'm sorry, there's laughing in my head.

utterance.speaker: MR A
utterance.content: Worth a shot, huh?

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: Look at this.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: These are from Halloween three years ago.

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: Oh, look, here's Barry. Did he have to come straight from the office?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No, that was his costume. See, he's actually an orthodontist, but he came as a regular dentist.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Um, you guys, you know when I said before, "thank you, but I don't really need your help"?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Actually, what I think you said was, "don't touch that, and get the hell out of my kitchen."

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Really? Weird. Anyway, see, I planned everything really well. I planned and I planned and I planned. It just turns out, I don't think I planned enough time to actually do it.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hey, Mon, you want some help?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: If you want.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hey. What a day. I took her everywhere. The Museum of Modern Art, Rockefeller Center, Statue of Liberty.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: She's still with you?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah. I guess she hasn't seen everything yet. I'll be right back, she has to go to the bathroom again. Oh, such a pretty face.

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: This is so much fun, just the girls. You know what we should do? Does anybody have any marijuana?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: God!

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: All right, look, nobody's smoking pot around all this food.

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: That's fine. I never did it. I just thought I might. So, what's new in sex?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh! What's new in sex?

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: The only man I've ever been with is your father.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I'm dicing, I'm dicing, I don't hear anything.

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: I mean, this is no offense to your dad, sweetie, but I was thinking there might be more.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sorry. You know what? I cannot have this conversation with you. I mean, god, you just come in here, and drop this bomb on me, before you even tell Daddy. What? What do you want? Do you want my blessing?

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: You want me to talk you out of it?

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Then what? What do you want?

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: I guess I just figured of all people you would understand this.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Why on earth would I understand this?

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: You didn't marry your Barry. I did.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: All right people, we're in trouble here. We've only got 12 hours and 36 minutes left. Move, move, move!

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Monica, I feel like you should have German subtitles.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Joey, speed it up!

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I'm sorry, it's the pigs. they're reluctant to get in the blankets!

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Monica, how did this happen? I thought you had this all planned out.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Do you want me to cry? Is that what you want? Do you wanna see me cry?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Sir! No sir!

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: All right, you!

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No. Look, I told you I am not a part of this thing.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: All right, look, Ross. I realize that you have issues with Carol and Susan, and I feel for you, I do. But if you don't help me cook, I'm gonna take a bunch of those little hot dogs, and I'm gonna create a new appetizer called "pigs in Ross". All right, ball the melon.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey! How come I'm stuck dicing, when he gets to ball the melon.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: How's it going?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: It's goin' great. Right on schedule. Got my little happy helpers.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Fine, whatever.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What's the matter?

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Nothing. Ok, everything. I think we're calling off the wedding.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You're still gonna pay me, right? Or something a little less selfish.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Carol, what's the matter? What happened?

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: My parents called this afternoon to say they weren't coming.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh my god.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: I mean, I knew they were having trouble with this whole thing, but they're my parents. They're supposed to give me away and everything.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: It's ok. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: And then Susan and I got in this big fight because I said maybe we should call off the wedding, and she said we weren't doing it for them, we were doing it for us, and if I couldn't see that, then maybe we should call off the wedding. I don't know what to do.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I uh can't believe I'm gonna say this, but I think Susan's right.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: You do?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Look, do you love her? And you don't have to be too emphatic about this.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Of course I do.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well then that's it. And if George and Adelaide can't accept that, then the hell with them. Look, if my parents didn't want me to marry you, no way that would have stopped me. Look, this is your wedding. Do it.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: You're right. Of course you're right.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: So we're back on?

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: We're back on.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You heard the woman. Peel, chop, devil! I can't believe I lost 2 minutes.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: It just seems so futile, you know ? All these women, and nothing. I feel like Superman without my powers, you know? I have the cape, and yet I cannot fly.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well now you understand how I feel every single day, ok? The world is my lesbian wedding.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Butterscotch? No one? All right, you'll be sorry later.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Any time.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Ross.

utterance.speaker: MINISTER
utterance.content: You know, nothing makes God happier than when two people, any two people, come together in love. Friends, family, we're gathered here today to join Carol and Susan in holy matrimony.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh my god. Now I've seen everything! Whoa, she's gone. She's gone. She's gone! Go ahead, get married. Go, go.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Would you look at them?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah, can't help but.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: How's that pig-in-the-blanket workin' out for you? I wrapped those bad boys.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I miss Rose.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, yeah?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I know it's kind of weird, but I mean, she was a big part of my life there, you know, and now I just feel kind of alone.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: You know, I uh, I couldn't help but overhear what you just said, and I think it's time for you to forget about Rose, move on with your life...how 'bout we go get you a drink?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, that's so nice.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I shouldn't even bother coming up with a line, right?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hey, Mom? Having fun?

utterance.speaker: MRS GREEN
utterance.content: Oh, am I! I just danced with a wonderfully large woman. And three other girls made eyes at me over the buffet. Oh, I'm not saying it's something I wanna pursue, but it's nice to know I have options.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: There's more alcohol, right?

utterance.speaker: SUSAN
utterance.content: How you doin'?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: SUSAN
utterance.content: You did a good thing today.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: SUSAN
utterance.content: You wanna dance?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No, that's fine.

utterance.speaker: SUSAN
utterance.content: Come on. I'll let you lead.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: All right look. Penis schmenis. We're all people.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok, which one of us do you think is gonna be the first one to get married?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, Mon, I was married.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, me, too, technically.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I had a wedding.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: All right, just trying to start an interesting discussion.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I got one. Which one of us do you think will be the last to get married?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Isn't Ben in this?

utterance.speaker: ALL
utterance.content: Oh, yeah!
